info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 14 at 1:40PM PDT until September 14 at 3:15PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR WESTERN CLARK COUNTY... At 140 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Rainbow Canyon, Spring Mountains, Mt. Charleston, Red Rock Canyon, Lovell Canyon Campground, Fletcher View Campground, Mary Jane Falls Campground, Kyle Canyon Campground, Hilltop Campground, Dolomite Campground, Mcwilliams Campground, Mahogany Grove Campground, Mountain Springs and Mt. Potosi. This includes the following highways... Kyle Canyon Road between mile markers 1 and 8. State Route 160 in Clark County near mile marker 21 and 39. Deer Creek Road between mile markers 1 and 8. This includes the following streams and drainages... Potosi Wash, Wheeler Wash and Lovell Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
